author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has been granted an extension after failing to fully divest all his assets in compliance with an ethics agreement, according to documents reviewed by Bloomberg.
title: Bessent Given Extension to Divest After Missing Ethics Deadline

author: Irina Anghel
description: Falling house prices are more widespread than at any time for a year as fears of tax rises and a bleaker economic outlook weigh on demand, a survey of UK estate agents found.
title: More Estate Agents Are Reporting Falling House Prices, RICS Says

author: Sana Pashankar, Loren Grush, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Wednesday to ease regulations for the commercial space industry, including steps to speed the licensing process for rocket launches in a win for the growing sector and onetime ally Elon Musk’s SpaceX.
title: Trump Signs Order to Ease Space Industry Regulations in Musk Win

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump revoked an executive order signed by former President Joe Biden that targeted consolidation in the agriculture, technology, and drug sectors, which the former administration argued had fed inflation by reducing competition.
title: Trump Revokes Biden Order Targeting Corporate Consolidation

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Four former presidents of Peru are now in jail at the same time, a new record for the country if not the world.
title: Peru Raises Its Count of Jailed Former Presidents to Four

author: Ted Mann
description: It was the end of 2018, and Google’s leaders were tired of being Number One.
title: Google Finds Workaround for Lobbying Rules That Omits Big Bosses

author: Joe Deaux, Jennifer A Dlouhy, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump’s controversial plan to take a cut of revenue from chip sales to China has US companies reconsidering their plans for business with the country, offering a model for circumventing years of trade tensions.
title: Trump’s Deal With Nvidia Offers Path Forward in Global Trade War

author: Misha Savic
description: Months of anti-government rallies in Serbia lapsed into violence again as supporters of President Aleksandar Vucic clashed with his opponents in three of the Balkan country’s biggest cities.
title: Political Protests in Serbia Turn Violent With Clashes in Country’s Biggest Cities

description: The Russian economy is spluttering under the weight of Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine just as Presidents Putin and Trump meet to talk peace
title: Exposing the Cracks at the Heart of Putin’s War Economy

author: Erica Yokoyama, Akemi Terukina
description: Japan’s economy likely managed to avoid falling into a recession by posting modest growth in the second quarter, as domestic demand led by capital spending offset the drag from US tariffs, according to economists surveyed by Bloomberg.
title: Japan Likely Eked Out Growth Last Quarter Even as Tariffs Hit

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: Forty-one former employees of Fannie Mae on Wednesday sued the company, its chief executive and Federal Housing Finance Agency Director Bill Pulte for alleged defamation related to their dismissals in April.
title: Fannie Mae Former Employees Sue Company, Pulte for Defamation

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at what comes next after the president’s summit with Putin. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Looks to the Next Step After Friday's Meeting With Putin

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned Israel and Russia that they may be added to a list of countries suspected of or responsible for sexual violence in armed conflict.
title: UN Chief Warns Israel Over Sexual Violence Concerns

author: John Ainger, Gabriel Diniz Tavares, Daniel Carvalho
description: This year’s United Nations climate summit, scheduled for November in Brazil, has been designed to make history by bringing world leaders, diplomats and some 50,000 other participants into the heart of the Amazon rain forest. Now the event increasingly risks being defined by a looming logistical fiasco.
title: Brazil Refuses to Move Climate Summit as Lodging Crisis Looms

author: Myles Miller
description: Federal agents assigned to patrol Washington as part of the federal takeover of the US capital are taking on duties that fall outside their usual jobs, provoking consternation that they’ve been diverted from work they were trained for to tasks they’ve never done.
title: Trump’s DC Takeover Thrusts Federal Agents Into Unfamiliar Roles

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: Monthly inflation in Argentina picked up some momentum last month as regulated price hikes collided with a peso overhang that sparked the currency’s worst month since 2023.
title: Argentina Inflation Posts Mild Acceleration After Policy Stumble

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A lawsuit accusing billionaire Elon Musk of unlawfully directing the closing of the US Agency for International Development can move ahead over the Trump administration’s objections, a Maryland federal judge ruled.
title: Fight Over Musk’s Role in Shuttering USAID Is Kept Alive by Judge

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland’s new president, Karol Nawrocki, unexpectedly joined a call of European leaders with Donald Trump on Wednesday instead of the country’s veteran prime minister in a sign of his emerging clout with the US administration.
title: Poland’s New President Bumps Tusk From Trump Call on Ukraine

author: Myles Miller
description: Mayor Eric Adams, facing a steep path to reelection, is bolstering efforts to reduce the number of mentally ill people on the streets and subways of New York City.
title: NYC Ramps Up Effort to Remove Mentally Ill From Streets, Subways

author: Beatriz Reis, Martha Viotti Beck
description: Brazil’s government on Wednesday rolled out a long-awaited relief package including 30 billion reais ($5.6 billion) in credit to support local companies hit by Donald Trump’s trade tariffs.
title: Brazil Unveils Relief Package to Blunt the Impact of US Tariffs

author: Alister Bull
description: The South African government distanced itself from remarks by the country’s top general during a visit to Iran, where he criticized Israel and voiced solidarity with the Islamic Republic.
title: South Africa Plays Down Comments by Its General Visiting Iran

author: Andrea Jaramillo, Oscar Medina
description: After losing its most popular presidential candidate to a shock shooting, Colombia’s conservative opposition is reeling.
title: Colombia’s Opposition Is Hobbled by Senator’s Murder, Leader’s Scandal

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he may name the next Federal Reserve chair “a little bit early” and added that he was down to three or four potential candidates as he looks for a successor to Jerome Powell.
title: Trump Signals He’ll Announce Fed Chair Pick ‘A Little Bit Early’

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump announced he would host the Kennedy Center Honors, which will go to actor Sylvester Stallone, rock band Kiss and singer Gloria Gaynor among others during the first year of his chairmanship of Washington, DC’s main performing arts center.
title: Trump to Host Kennedy Center Honors for Stallone, Kiss

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he would ask Congress to approve a crime bill that would allow him greater authority over Washington, DC’s police department as well as new spending to fund beautification projects, days after announcing he was taking control of law enforcement in the capital.
title: Trump to Ask Congress for DC-Specific Crime Bill, Funding

author: Chris Dolmetsch
description: President Donald Trump has called for a “new” census that excludes undocumented migrants from its count. If this new census were realized and used for the core functions of the current one — determining how seats in the Electoral College and the US House of Representatives are apportioned and how some federal funding is distributed — it would have wide-ranging implications for the US.
title: Trump Wants to Exclude Undocumented Immigrants From the Census. What to Know

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Leaders from France, Germany and the United Kingdom threatened to reimpose UN sanctions on Iran if the Islamic State does not reach a nuclear deal by the end of August.
title: France, Germany, UK Threaten to Reimpose UN Sanctions on Iran

author: Samy Adghirni, Arne Delfs, Alberto Nardelli
description: European leaders urged Donald Trump to press Vladimir Putin to agree to a ceasefire and a meeting with Volodymyr Zelenskiy when he sits down with the Russian president on Friday.
title: European Leaders Urge Trump to Press Putin to Meet Zelenskiy

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Trump administration can cut billions of dollars in foreign assistance funds approved by Congress for this year, a US appeals court ruled.
title: Court Lets Trump Block Billions of Dollars in Foreign Aid

author: Matthew Hill
description: The partial collapse of a waste dam at a Chinese state-owned copper mine in Zambia may have released 30 times more toxic sludge into the environment than previously reported, according to an independent evaluation of the disaster.
title: Toxic Spill at China-Owned Zambian Mine 30 Times Worse Than Estimated

author: Saleha Mohsin
description: The Trump administration is considering several private sector candidates for chair of the Federal Reserve when the role opens in May, including a strategist at Jefferies LLC and an executive at BlackRock Inc., according to an administration official.
title: Fed Search Continues With Private Sector Candidates

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland may cut its order of 36 Lockheed Martin Corp. F-35 stealth fighters after failing to push through a fixed-price deal with the US government, driving up the cost by as much as 1.3 billion Swiss francs ($1.6 billion).
title: Swiss May Reduce F-35 Purchase as US Squeezes Government

author: Okech Francis
description: South Sudan’s government denied reports that it’s in talks with Israel about relocating Palestinians from the Gaza Strip in the East African nation.
title: South Sudan Denies Talks With Israel on Relocating Palestinians

author: Lucy White
description: US Vice President JD Vance met Reform UK’s Nigel Farage on Wednesday morning ahead of crucial talks with European leaders over the future of Ukraine.
title: Vance Meets Reform Leader Farage Ahead of Crunch Ukraine Talks

author: Piotr Bujnicki
description: Poland inked a $3.8 billion deal to modernize its existing fleet of F-16 fighter jets to better deter potential Russian aggression.
title: Poland Inks $3.8 Billion Deal to Update F16 Jets in Defense Push

author: Daniel Flatley, Jonathan Ferro, Annmarie Hordern
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent made his most explicit call yet for the Federal Reserve to execute a cycle of interest-rate cuts, suggesting the central bank’s benchmark ought to be at least 1.5 percentage points lower than it is now.
title: Bessent Urges Fed to Lower Rates by 150 Basis Points or More

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Daniel Flatley
description: US President Donald Trump said he would be speaking to European leaders shortly as he prepares for his summit later this week with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin.
title: Trump Says He’ll Speak to Allies Soon as Putin Meeting Nears

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukraine claimed a strike on a Russian oil-pumping station in Unecha, a hub for the country’s network of crude-exporting pipelines.
title: Ukraine Claims Attack on Hub for Major Russian Oil Pipelines

author: Matthew Bristow
description: A surge in cocaine production is boosting the power of organized crime.
title: Drugs and Gangs Are Menacing Latin America

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s Constitutional Court will rule on Aug. 29 whether to disqualify Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, who has been previously suspended from duty, over allegations she breached ethical standards in handling a border dispute with Cambodia.
title: Thai PM Faces Ouster as Court Poised to Rule in Ethics Case

author: Christina Kyriasoglou, Michael Nienaber
description: The German military is looking to secure 8,300 drone systems by the end of the decade, far fewer than some of its NATO allies aim for, as spending on unmanned defense systems and autonomous weapons soars globally.
title: German Military Targets 8,300 Drone Systems, Lagging NATO Allies

author: Ben Sills
description: Vladimir Putin is heading to Friday’s planned summit with Donald Trump confident that Russia is in a dominant position on the battlefield as his military advances in Ukraine.
title: Putin Heads to Trump Summit Confident He Is Winning in Ukraine

author: Ugur Yilmaz
description: In exclusive comments, Ekrem Imamoglu said he still hopes to run for president — but he signals he expects a long legal battle.
title: Jailed Istanbul Mayor Is Ready to Back Others Against Erdogan

author: Philip Glamann
description: China sanctioned a pair of banks in the EU, fulfilling a promise to retaliate after the bloc targeted some Chinese lenders over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: China Sanctions Two EU Banks, Hitting Back at Europe’s Moves

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: South Africa’s trade department has drafted proposed regulations that will allow exporters to collaborate to ease the impact of 30% tariffs the US levied on imports from the nation.
title: South Africa to Allow Exporter Collaboration as Tariffs Kick In

author: Paul Richardson
description: South Africa’s government slammed a report published by US President Donald Trump’s administration that said the human-rights situation in the African nation “significantly worsened” last year.
title: South Africa Rebukes US Over ‘Deeply Flawed’ Human Rights Report

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea unveiled a 210 trillion won ($152 billion) fiscal plan for 2026-2030 to support President Lee Jae Myung’s core pledges, with funding to be drawn from enhanced revenue measures and greater spending efficiency.
title: Korea to Spend $150 Billion to Fund President Lee’s Policy Goals

author: Shruti Srivastava, Swati Gupta
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his ruling party have seized on growing friction with US President Donald Trump to bolster support from farmers ahead of a crucial state election.
title: Modi Uses Trump Backlash in India to Bolster Support Before Vote

author: Paul-Alain Hunt
description: Peru’s presidential election in April could lead to disruptions at MMG Ltd.’s flagship Las Bambas copper mine, Chief Executive Officer Zhao Jing Ivo said during an earnings call on Wednesday.
title: MMG Warns Peru Election Poses Risk to Las Bambas Copper Mine

author: Sakura Murakami, Yuko Takeo
description: Japan’s chief trade negotiator and Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s right hand man said he’ll support Ishiba if the ruling Liberal Democratic Party calls an early leadership race.
title: Japan’s Akazawa Says Would Support Ishiba in Another LDP Race

author: Tom Rees
description: Britain’s embattled statistics organization is facing more real-terms cuts to its core funding despite concerns that financial pressures were one of the main factors behind a crisis in the country’s economic data.
title: UK’s Crisis-Stricken Statistics Body Faces More Funding Cuts

author: Sakura Murakami
description: The rate of actual Japanese investment forming part of a $550 billion US fund could be higher than the 1-2% initially cited, Japan’s top negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said in a live television interview on Wednesday.
title: Japan’s Investment in $550 Billion US Fund Could Be More Than 2%

author: Jon Herskovitz
description: India and China are restoring economic links strained by a deadly 2020 border clash, the latest sign Prime Minister Narendra Modi is drawing closer to BRICS after US President Donald Trump hit the South Asian nation with a 50% tariff.
title: India-China Thaw Takes Shape as Modi Embraces BRICS Over Trump

author: Kok Leong Chan, Anisah Shukry
description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak won the right to petition to serve the rest of his prison term under house arrest, in a major victory for the jailed politician and his supporters.
title: Jailed Ex-Malaysia PM Najib Allowed to Petition for House Arrest

author: Joe Lovinger, Julie Fine
description: Democratic lawmakers from Texas say they’re considering their options amid reports they could return to the state as soon as this weekend, a move that could end a standoff in which more than 50 state representatives left in a bid to block controversial new congressional maps backed by President Donald Trump.
title: Texas Democrats Weigh Return to State in Redistricting Showdown

author: Philip Glamann
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent dismissed the possibility that Chinese investments in the US could be part of any trade pact, comments that narrow the options for the two sides to resolve their running dispute.
title: Bessent Dismisses China Investing in US as Part of a Trade Deal
